sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Die Martis, 24 October, 1643. The Lords and Commons in Parliament having received certain notice of a cessation of arms concluded with the rebells in Ireland, ... England and Wales. Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Edward Husbands, London : October 24. 1643.
Title from caption and first lines of text. An Order of Parliament "that all merchants who shall be willing to set out ships at their own charge, shall have letters of mart to take all the ships, goods, and merchandize of any persons in arms against the King and Parliament.". Order to print signed: H: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Die Martis, 24 October, 1643. The Lords and Commons in Parliament having received certain notice of a cessation of arms concluded with the rebells in Ireland, ... England and Wales. Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Edward Husbands, London : October 24. 1643.
Title from caption and first lines of text. An Order of Parliament "that all merchants who shall be willing to set out ships at their own charge, shall have letters of mart to take all the ships, goods, and merchandize of any persons in arms against the King and Parliament.". Order to print signed: H: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Edward Husbands
